questions.text: The benzene molecule has an unusual shape, which was actually discovered in a scientist's dream. What is that shape?
questions.explanation:
Ring.

	The "benzene ring" is one of the most famous shapes in chemical history. Benzene is composed of six carbon atoms and six hydrogen atoms. German chemist Friedrich Kekule was puzzled as to how the atoms joined together. One night, he dreamed of a snake biting its tail- and woke up knowing the structure of the molecule.

questions.text: Speaking of organic chemistry, what one element do all organic compounds share?
questions.explanation:
Carbon.

	While all of these elements are found in organic compounds, only carbon is found in every organic compound. Due to its ability to form many sorts of bonds, carbon is the workhorse of the chemistry of living things.

questions.text: Strip, tunnel and shaft are all types of...
questions.explanation:
Mines.

	A strip mine is one where everything is scraped from the land to get at the mined substances. Shaft mines are vertical holes dug into earth and rock. Tunnel mines are similar, but are horizontal.

questions.text: A famous cancer research institute and cancer care center located in Los Angeles is called "City of ___________."
questions.explanation:
Hope.

	City of Hope runs many programs designed both to treat cancer patients and to develop new treatments for cancer.

questions.text: The compound eyes of insects are divided into small units called...
questions.explanation:
Facets.

	The eyes of some insects may be composed of hundreds of facets. Each facet has its own lens.

questions.text: If you are shopping in Mexico, a useful phrase to know is "Demasiado caro!" It means "too________________."
questions.explanation:
Expensive.

	When shopping in Mexico, one must learn the art of bargaining! It helps to know at least some of the language.

questions.text: The Norwegian Petroleum Museum boasts the largest _________________ in the world.
questions.explanation:
Drill bit.

	Used for oil drilling (naturally!) it measures one yard (90 cm.) in diameter and weighs 3748 lbs (1700 kg.)

questions.text: The measure of how much dissolved minerals water contains is...
questions.explanation:
Hardness.

	The most common dissolved minerals in water are calcium and magnesium. Water is usually harder in areas with little rainfall.

questions.text: So what do all of these answers have in common?
questions.explanation:
Diamond & diamonds.

	Q. 1- Diamonds are often used in rings. Q. 2- Diamonds are a form of carbon. Q. 3- Baseball is played on a diamond. Q. 4- Diamonds are obtained from mines.   Q. 5- The Hope Diamond is a famous diamond. Q. 6- The faces of a carved diamond are called facets.  Q. 7- Diamonds are not cheap! Q. 8- Diamond coating is often used on drill bits. Q. 9- On the Mohs scale of hardness, diamonds are the hardest mineral.
